卸.definition: to unload; to unhitch; to remove or strip; to get rid of

卸套.definition: to loosen a yoke; to remove harness (from beast of burden)

卸妝.definition: to remove makeup; (old) to take off formal dress and ornaments

卸磨殺驢.definition: lit. to kill the donkey when the grinding is done (idiom); fig. to get rid of sb once he has ceased to be useful

卸職.definition: to resign from office; to dismiss from office

卸肩兒.definition: lit. a weight off one's shoulders; fig. to resign a post; to lay down a burden; to be relieved of a job

卸裝.definition: (of an actor) to remove makeup and costume; (computing) to uninstall; to unmount

卸貨.definition: to unload cargo; (fig.) to give birth to a baby

卸責.definition: to avoid responsibility; to shift the responsibility onto others; (Tw) to relieve sb of their responsibilities (e.g. upon retirement)

卸除.definition: to remove; to get rid of

卸頭.definition: (of a woman) to take off one's head ornaments and jewels
